alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Susquehanna; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 12 at 11:30PM EDT until March 13 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Significant blowing snow and lake effect snow. Winds gusting 35 to 45 mph. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches, highest north of I-86 and NY-17. * WHERE...In Pennsylvania, Bradford, Susquehanna and Wyoming Counties. In New York, Tioga and Broome Counties. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and create icy spots on previously plowed roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Bands of lake effect snow will be locally heavy at times. Winds will continue to be gusty through the night. Significant blowing and drifting snow will be the main hazard overnight. Also, wind chills will also drop between 0 and -10 degrees at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for New York can be found at 511ny.org, and for Pennsylvania at 511pa.com. Or, dial 5-1-1 from within the respective state.
